author: Keach Hagey
title: Inside Telemundo’s Battle with Univision for American Hispanics
text:
Five years ago, Telemundo had less than half the audience of rival Univision and was headquartered in a former shoe warehouse in a neighborhood that flooded each time a hurricane blew through Miami.
Today, the Spanish-language broadcaster owned by Comcast Corp. is nipping at long-dominant Univision’s heels in the ratings, consistently beating it in the 10 p.m. time slot with edgy narconovelas—soap operas about Mexican drug lords—aimed at a new generation of bilingual Latinos. Next month, Telemundo employees from six scattered... So how did we get here? Illustration: Shaumbe Wright/WSJ
